content.description: Jam and layback a handcrack splitting a tan and orange wall to a small lege below a roof (25ft.) Climb the body length roof (5.10) on finger and handjams to a slopey ledge. Amble up this and climb an easy 10ft chimney to a spacious tree ledge, I left yellow 1in nylon webbing around a large healthy pine.
content.protection: Small standard rack, BD #1,2's, and a .5/.75 for the roof crack
content.location: Take the Upper Hogskin Loop Trail up to the old road cut and go west (left). After approx. 1mi. the climb starts on the right after a short scramble up a pine straw covered hill. Look for an obvious splitter crack capped with a 6 foot roof. There should be some neon yellow webbing around a pine tree at the top.

content.description: North Chick gorge is well known to Chattanooga locals as home to a nice swimming hole called the Blue Hole. It is also a fantastic place for whitewater kayaking, as well as home to several high quality rock climbs. The climbs tend to have adventurous approaches, but are often well worth the effort. Rock quality can be crumbly at the worst, and as good as anything at the best. Expect a mix, as well as some adventure.
